title: 2 Euro (Expo Milano 2015)

composition.text: Bimetallic: nickel brass clad nickel centre in copper-nickel ring

obverse.description: In the field a composition symbolizing the fertility of Earth: on a semicircle standing for the terrestrial globe, a seed fed by water and about to germinate; above the Earth, a vine shoot, an olive branch and a sheaf of wheat growing out of a tree trunk; above, archshaped inscription “NUTRIRE IL PIANETA”; on the left, initials  of  the designer Maria Grazia Urbani “MGU”; on the right, acronym of the Italian Republic “RI” and the letter “R” identifying  the Mint  of Rome; in the middle, logo of the EXPO MILANO 2015; all around, the twelve stars of the European Union.
obverse.lettering:
NUTRIRE IL PIANETA
RI
MGU R
EXPO 2015
MILANO 2015

reverse.description: A map, next to the face value, shows the European continent without borders.

comments:
Milano was the location for the Expo 2015, a great event on food and nutrition.
For six months, from May 1 to October 31 2015, Milano hosted the Universal Exposition, an international kermesse where all participating countries showed the best of their food technologies to take on a world challenge, promoting healthy and safe foods which are available to all mankind as a guarantee of a sustainable and peaceful future.

edge.description: Finely ribbed with edge lettering: six times the sequence "2 * * " alternately upright and inverted.

mints.name: Istituto Poligrafico e Zecca dello Stato
